item.title: How to Monitor an Ubuntu Server with Grafana and Prometheus
item.description: Grafana is an open source metric analytics & visualization tool which can help us to monitor the system with a nice Dashboard. Step 1: Installing Grafana Grafana is available in the APT packages repository, however it could not be the latest version, so we’ll use the official Grafana repository. First, it is needed to create the file /etc/apt/sources.list.d/grafana.list and add the following into it: deb https://packages.grafana.com/oss/deb stable main There is a separate repository for beta releases:
